de.topicmapslab.tmql4j.query
Interface IQueryProcessor

All Known Implementing Classes:
TMQLQueryProcessor, TMQLQueryProcessor
public interface IQueryProcessor

Interface definition of a query processor provide a language transformation between a query language and TMQL. The query processor should provide methods to check if a string-represented query can be proceeded by this instance. The processor also should provide a transformation algorithm.

Author:
Sven Krosse

Method Detail

isValid

boolean isValid(java.lang.String query)
Method checks if the given string represented query is a valid query of the processor-represented query language.

Parameters:
query - the query as string literal
Returns:
true if the query is valid in the context of the processor-represented query language, false otherwise.

getQuery

IQuery getQuery(org.tmapi.core.TopicMap topicMap,
                java.lang.String query)
Method provides a query instance of the specific language.

Parameters:
topicMap - the topic map
query - the query
Returns:
a data object representing the query of the specific language
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the given string cannot represent within the current language

asTmqlQuery

IQuery asTmqlQuery(org.tmapi.core.TopicMap topicMap,
                   java.lang.String query)
Method transforms the given query to a TMQL query.

Parameters:
topicMap - the topic map
query - the query
Returns:
the corresponding TMQL query
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the given string cannot represent within the current language
java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - thrown if the transformation is not supported by the current processor

getLanguageName

java.lang.String getLanguageName()
Return the name of the current query language.

Returns:
the language name
